intro: Calyptrogyne ghiesbreghtiana, commonly known as the mangrove apple, is a flowering plant native to coastal regions of Southeast Asia. It is a shrub or small tree that thrives in saline and brackish water environments, typically found in mangrove ecosystems. The plant has pinnately compound leaves and produces small, yellowish flowers that are clustered in inflorescences. Its fruit is a fleshy, red berry that contains several seeds, aiding in its dispersal. The species plays an important ecological role in stabilizing coastal soils and providing habitat for various marine and terrestrial organisms.
